conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to analyze the forces acting on object A and determine the height it rises and the stiffness coefficient k2 of the light spring C.
A is at rest.
B is fixed on the horizontal surface.
C is connected to B and has a spring constant k2.
The right endpoint of C is at position a.
The light rope on the upper end of A is just vertically straight.
The gravitational force of A is mg = 2kg × 9.8m/s² = 19.6N.
The tension force in the rope on the upper end of A is T = mg = 19.6N.
The force of the spring in B is k1x = 200N/m × 0.6m = 120N.
The force of the spring in C is k2x = k2 × 0.6m = k2 × 0.6m.
The tension force in the rope on the upper end of A is equal to the gravitational force of A.
The force of the spring in B is equal to the force of the spring in C.
The force of the spring in C is equal to the force of the spring in B.
The equation of motion for A is mẍ = -k1x - k2x.
Substituting the values of k1 and k2, we get mẍ = -200N/m × 0.6m - k2 × 0.6m.
Simplifying, we get mẍ = -120N - k2 × 0.6m.
The height that object A rises is x = 1/2 × mẍ/k2.
Substituting the values of m and k2, we get x = 1/2 × 2kg × 1/2 × 19.6N/0.6m/200N/m × 0.6m.
Simplifying, we get x = 1/2 × 19.6N/120N.
Calculating, we get x = 1/2 × 0.1667 = 0.0833m.
